result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob T Dooley

defendant.name: Dooley, Jacob T
defendant.address: 8140 W North Ave Apt 1, Wauwatosa, WI 53213

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jacob T Dooley in court, by zoom, with attorney Scott Alan Wales, by zoom.

Defendant is engage in a 20 week treatment program.  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Letter from Attorney Wales requesting that he and his client be permitted to appear via Zoom for the hearing on 7/18.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/14/2022 - Approved.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is ordered to report to the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.

08:35 AM Defendant Jacob T Dooley appeared by Zoom with attorney Scott Alan Wales who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Victim A appeared by Zoom and is asking for a no violent contact order.  Attorney Wales intends on filing a formal motion to address bail at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Check Case scheduled for July 1, 2022.

Atty Wales would like to reschedule for 6/23. He has a hearing in Milwaukee Co. - Sent to CC Herring for review
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 06/20/2022   Denied, Victim notification an issue. Defendant and counsel may appear via zoom

To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 1st, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
